bow: do you really need to wait year or two to let your body heal after your first baby ve really been wanting another baby lately want my month old son to have sibling and while do miss the months of nausea had love pretty much everything that being pregnant and mommy entails that being said had my son almost months ago and most books will tell you that you need to let your body heal and regain iron again before you get pregnant again or else you increase risk of miscarriage and complications want to do it right but also not getting any younger and know age does help the process opinions stories etc had my children very close together and my midwives doctors never once suggested that wait few years between children came out of it just fine and my children are happy and healthy know it suggested to wait to allow recovery both physically and mentally but became unexpectedly pregnant with my second when my first was only months old and the pregnancy went fine never did my doctors seem concerned that was having them so close it can be exhausting having two kids so close in age but ve been told many times once they re older it easier than if they were further apart we ll see eta my mom had kids in years not that suggesting you go and do that but we all came out fine though still call her up and ask her how on earth she did it she says it was bit of blur can only imagine do think you need to wait think sometimes gals who had section are told to wait not sure how long to heal but in general do think you need to wait too long just found out that my husband grandma had kids within years no twins um that just blew my mind bit do think you need to wait guess if ever had csection that would make me hesitant however if you have vaginal birth say if you want to you should pregnant with my third first is second is 13 months fell pregnant when the second was months old let me tell you being months pregnant running around after fully mobile one year old is hard work the pain and strain is starting to take its toll having only 16 months between the babies is going to be tougher still the benefit is that the babies will never know the difference and will have ready to go playmate in my experience the first year of motherhood is massive jump in terms of adjustment to the role but the second year brings whole heap of other trials and challenges feel my babies will miss out on the one to one attention from me that my older daughter enjoyed but there are lots of other benefits too if you feel happy and healthy go for it start taking the vitamins now but do put the pressure on yourself to conceive straight away just have fun and love your little family for the way it is now especially if they want more than children or to try vaginal birth the risk of rupture gets considerably higher if the scar tissue has not had time to heal got pregnant when my first was 14 months with no complications and my doctors were not worried when you get pregnant they will check your iron and if it low they will put you on iron supplements had to take iron supplements for both of my pregnancies had three children in four years no complications at all ve had children altogether and with each one my body healed quicker deleted deleted talk to your doctor and see what they say for your specific situation there are number of studies that show increased risks when the mother gets pregnant within months of birth and suggest the optimal time to wait is years however many healthy women have close together babies with no problems also consider the difficulty of having very young children at once year old that is fully mobile but not yet able to consistently follow directions is tough companion for newborn just getting them both in and out of car is juggling act it great for some people hell for others remember you do get sleep when the baby sleeps naps the second time around got pregnant when my first child was 17 months so my kids are years apart and was really happy with that spacing my first is able to follow directions play by herself for little while and understand how to be gentle around the baby which makes things lot easier in the first few months your mileage may vary of course four days overdue and generally upset at the moment so take that into consideration would change my being pregnant now for the world but my body is falling apart all of the muscles that got stretched and worn out by my son did have chance to bounce back in pain all the time of course nobody is worried about my kids being close medically there is no reason to be just wanted to put in my two cents here and say it is safe but is it worth the compounded effects on your body once again happen to be blimp right now good luck you do mention your feeding method was nursing my month old when found out was pregnant with baby my doctor suggested switch to formula but really wanted to continue nursing he put me on calcium supplements it got to the point where if missed my supplement in the morning my teeth would hurt in the evening then when my daughter was 11 months my milk supply dried up my body could handle double duty anymore so all of this was to say if you re nursing talk to your doctor about the possibilities good luck with making the best decision for your family my oldest was months old when found out was pregnant with my 2nd having that close together is hard at first but now it awesome my oldest just turned week ago the youngest will be in october they are best friends playmates ca imagine it any other way good to know mine are 18 months apart this is spot on being months pregnant chasing very active 17 month old was pain in the everywhere but now that they re and they re best friends playmates and cuddle buddies think we made the right decision in having them so close it may not be for everyone but they entertain each other and get breaks because of that felt completely healed and back to normal by the time my little one was months old and was pregnant again when he was 11 months took vitamins and ate well think taking care of your body and having good sleeper are key to your body recovering enough to do another pregnancy well it not easy so highly recommend you get back to your goal weight an decent level of fitness first because it exhausting to be prego while caring for toddler say talk to your dr about it in any situation like this you ll hear good and bad stories the only person qualified to tell you if your body is strong enough to handle another pregnancy right now is your obgyn nurses at lot of thinking to do received few comments like yours very insightful thank you had 10 month old twins when found out was pregnant with third the pregnancy was as tough as it was with the twins but was definitely ready to be done my ob gyn was concerned about there only being 10 months in between pregnancies she basically said it happens lot take your vitamins eat well rest as much as you can and your baby will be fine the third was born almost year ago when the twins were 17 months old so had three under two for months never thought would take on that challenge the girls immediately fell in love with her and have become her protector of course they get thoroughly annoyed with her every five minutes my husband is awesome and took on the nighttime care for the twins while went one on one with the baby it been difficult year but we are also seeing the light at the end of the tunnel of babydom the twins are almost out of diapers and are becoming more helpful around the house they also can get up and down stairs and they can walk with me without needing to be carried not having to carry all of them everywhere has been one of the best milestones that we ve hit so far going to the park or the library is so much easier this summer the first year with baby and your older one will be tough but it is still lot of fun and only seems to get more fun as they get bigger our baby is already walking and climbing and basically doing everything possible to catch up to her older sisters they are lot of work but it been totally worth it happens to the best of us the only thing ve heard is that it takes about 18 months for your body to properly heal between babies that being said people break that limit all the time if you re mentally ready to have another say go for it many women can have children back to back and they have no problems good for them personally for me would like my body to have time to bounce back always wanted kids close in age but now rethinking it pregnant but have managed to lose all of that plus an additional 40 in the past 13 months just had my physical and all my labs came back normal except for being border line low for vit with that said even gotten my period back either way each women should look at herself and how she feels and maybe go as far as discussing it with her doctor how long her recovery period is before having an other
